intro: Ranunculus fallax subsp. transkuopioensis, commonly known as the Transkuopio Ranunculus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to Finland. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in forested areas. The plant features delicate, palmately divided leaves and yellow flowers with five petals. It is part of the buttercup family (Ranunculaceae) and is characterized by its unique floral structure and habitat preferences. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
